reviews.review: Sin duda este juego me engancho completamente, supero las espectativas, una gran continuacion del Portal,  la historia es realmente buena me ha dejado sin palabras, el modo coop requiere de un gran trabajo en equipo o de lo contrario no pasaras los niveles literalmente, tambien me gusto mucho lo de poder hacer camaras de pruebas, de verdad hay una enorme variedad de camaras de pruebas que aun a mi me falta probar pero estoy segura de que todas son increibles :D,  vale mucho la pena comprar el juego, hasta los mismos creditos son buenos! jaja yo se que el numero 3 es un mito pero ojala salga un tercer juego :) Lo amo totalmente <3
It's time to test.
very nice 10/10 glados is my only freind now.
So far I have only played the multiplayer of this game and it is great. You and a friend work together to figure out how to beat the level. 10/10 would recommend.

IncrÃ­vel, vale cada centavo se vocÃª procura um jogo com histÃ³ria, quebra-cabeÃ§as e humor
Klasse Coop Spiel!

[u] Positive: [/u] [b] Story - [/b] The story is amazing. You would think that after creating such an amazing story, how could they follow it up? But with with the bumbling Wheatley, [spoiler] GLaDOS coming back, [/spoiler] and the backstory of how Aperture came to be, the singleplayer campaign can easily take up half of your total playtime for the game. [b] PTI - [/b] The Perpetual Testing Initiative is one of my favorite parts of the game. Because it is a level editor, you can create infinite test chambers with infinite possibilities, each as simple or as complex as you like. With Cave Johnson talking to you in every downloaded test, it seems like a whole new game. From turret traps to gel puzzles, there's something for everyone in the PTI. [b] Co-op -[/b] Personally, I have not played Co-op very much. I have played a few levels though, and from that I can determine that it was put together perfectly. From the ping tool to the emotes, the Co-op could be sold as an entire other game, or at least DLC. Whether you choose to be Atlas or P-Body, the fun will never end when you recruit a buddy.

[u] Negative: [/u] [b] Puzzle Elements - [/b] Even with as many elements as there are, the level editor still seems small. Allowing players to create their own elements and publish the models to the workshop (Like in TF2) would be a lot more fun. Also the bugs. There have been bugs so exploitable, they even have names. "Portal Bumping" or "Bunny Hopping" for instance. Either the devs don't care, or haven't paid enough attention to the game. [b] PTI - [/b] The PTI is severely lacking. While you can get the basic puzzle layout, things like the Underground theme and the Overgrown one are not available unless using less simple external mods. Having a theme selector to change the look of puzzle elements and backgrounds and such (Much like in Super Mario Maker) Could drastically improve the quality. [b] Items - [/b] The items are given an entirely new look, but one that is nowhere near as familiar as the original things from the first game.

[u] Conclusion: [/u] I would definitely tell you to get this game. You would definitely appreciate it more if you played the first game, but you don't even really have to. It was actually hard to come up with a list of negatives that looked as big as the positives.
TOP

Me pareciÃ³ igual que el Portal 1 (lo cual es bueno, porque tambiÃ©n me gustÃ³), pero mejorado. Mucho mÃ¡s largo, con nuevos puzzles, una historia mÃ¡s currada, 2 personajes muy carismÃ¡ticos y hasta te rÃ­es en algunas partes (cosa que a mÃ­ no me pasa mucho en juegos de 1 jugador xD).

RecomendadÃ­simo.

Portal 2 has improved the already great predecessor in nearly every area. The game is twice as long as Portal 1 and provides many new gameplay elements, as light bridges, paint-gels and tractor beams in addition to the already established material. And the voice acting and the dialogue-writing teams again deserve a special price for extremely good work (In the English and German version at least).

And in addition to the great single player campaign the game provides a fun coop-campaign, which you can play with some friends. In this mode, you have two players with a portal gun, who can explore a new adventure in which cooperation is the key to success. There is also an option to import new chambers from the steam workshop, so there is an endless room for exploring.

The graphics and soundtrack are also pretty good, but at the end that doesn't really matter. Portal 2 improves an already great game in every area and gives you an extremely unique experience, that no Video Gamer should miss out on and that is what counts.

9.5/10

Amazing game! Yeah sometimes I wanna smash my head in a wall because of certain areas, but all that aside I haven't had this much fun with a game in so long. This is a must play and especially if you have friends who can play the awesome co-op with you. I really need to get my hands on Portal 1 now.

This was the first game I ever purchased on my steam account and so far I have had no regrets. 

PROS
-GREAT CAMPAIGN
-Lovable Characters
-Wheatly
-I think I need to reiterate: Wheatly is the most memorable character I have ever come across
-Community Maps!!!!!!!
-It was made in the source engine so it can run on almost everything (At the time I ran it on a Pentium with 4gb of Ram and no dedicated graphics)
-One of my favourite endings of all time
-Great OST

CONS
-Some people may be disappointed with the ending and the fact that there is probably going to be no Portal 3
-The difficulty: I only had to look at a walkthrough once but there are some really hard parts
*****SPOILER AHEAD*****




















-WHY DID WHEATLY HAVE TO BECOME EVIL!!!!




















To conclude, Portal 2 is in my opinion one of the greatest games of all time
I recommend it to everyone who likes a story based puzzle game that has tons of replayability
9.8/10

[h1] A True Classic [/h1]

No matter how many times I play this game, it never gets old. I played the game at least 10+ times over on my XBox, and every time I beat the game, I learned something new I didn't know before.

Overall, [b] buy this game. [/b] You wont regret it!

One of the greatest games I've ever played. Good characters, good story, great level design, fun/challenging puzzles, great new mechanics, great graphics, great sound design, hilarious writing, etc. It expands drastically on what made Portal so great. I actually can't really think of a single negative aspect of the game. Trivial stuff like, "Oh, it's too short!" isn't valid criticism and i can't levy that toward the game. It's just a solid piece of entertainment through and through.
